ygData.subject: How can I create a complete graph in Heritrix?
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello everybody, As I sent a email to Gordon this afternoon (below), I want to record and get suggestion how can I get more information about a URI before it

Subject: How can I create a complete graph in Heritrix?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=445716684; y=s-Nol8vcRwa3yeeUTLlCiT8Vw4tXhEh9pWF76nRgZ_c9EleU581MYBIN

Hello everybody,

As I sent a email to Gordon this afternoon (below), I wan=
t to record and get suggestion how can I get more information about a URI b=
efore it get 'uniqued'. As I read at "Mohr-et-al-2004', the way to decide w=
hat to do with a URI is at Prefetch, more exactly in Preselector. But I don=
't have a clue what filter or rule can help me. Any suggestions?

Att.
Elve=
rton.

=3D> The original message:
-----------------------------------------=
----------------------
 Hello Gordon,

 My name is Elverton. I'm doing a re=
search in a metric to estimate the numbers of URL of a domain. I have a pro=
blem to solve and you think you can help me.

 I want to make a complete gr=
aph of all URL's collected but all I have from crawl.log is the "father" of=
 the URL and the URL. This would be necessary but I have an misundertanding=
 about one thing: If heritrix collect one URL, suppose "yahoo.com" from "go=
ogle.com". If the heritrix enter in "amazon.com" and found "yahoo.com" agai=
n, in crawl.log will appear:

 - - - yahoo.com - google.com
 - - - yahoo.co=
m - amazon.com

 or only:

 - - - yahoo.com - google.com

 So, the heritrix=
 will ignore the found in "amazon.com" because it was already found in "goo=
gle.com"?

 Att.
 Elverton.

----------------------------------------------=
-----------------

=3D> Gordon's answer:

---------------------------------=
------------------------------

You're correct, the crawl.log is not enough=
 info to make a full web
graph... it only records the exact paths that led =
to a URI being first
discovered. You'd need to log more from the crawler be=
fore it 'uniques'
the URIs for crawling purposes, or perform a post-crawl a=
nalysis on the
full link-containing content, to create the web graph.

- Go=
rdon

---------------------------------------------------------------
